byline.contributor: Helene Bienvenu reported from Horgos and Roszke, Hungary, and Rick Lyman from Budapest. Reporting was contributed by Palko Karasz from Budapest; Joseph Orovic from Zadar, Croatia; Kimberly Bradley from Vienna; Boryana Dzhambazova from Edirne, Turkey; James Kanter from Brussels; and Emmarie Huetteman and Katarina Johannsen from Frauenstein, Austria.
byline.original: By HELENE BIENVENU and RICK LYMAN

abstract: Hungary closes gap in border fence with Serbia, forcing thousands of migrants to line up to be processed one by one; officials hope new barriers will discourage migrants from traveling to country in first place.
lead_paragraph: Tough laws aimed at keeping out migrants came into effect early Tuesday, a harsh new element in the European Union’s struggle with the crisis.

headline.main: Hungary Blocks Migrants in Border Crackdown
headline.print_headline: Cracking Down on Flow of Migrants, Hungary Blocks a Key Crossing Point

snippet: Tough laws aimed at keeping out migrants came into effect early Tuesday, a harsh new element in the European Union’s struggle with the crisis.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
